list_definition.definition: the place or position next to a person’s bed

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He was at her bedside when she died

list_ex_of_english: Ideally, it translates the principles of medical ethics into care at the bedside.
The group moves to the patient's bedside, whereupon the instructor explains to the soldier that the drug will make him better.
Attention can be objectively measured at the bedside.
The scene cuts from his bedside to what is evidently a flashback - some kind of traumatic memory is returning to his (altered) consciousness.
Vestibular function can also be assessed at the bedside.
A simple bedside assessment should be used and the findings recorded within the clerking pro forma for stroke patients.
I have sat many times with a relative at the bedside of an unconscious, dying parent and watched the tears and memories flow.
Self-medication allows the patient to retain drugs in a locked bedside cabinet and take responsibility for administering them at the appropriate time, with nursing facilitation.
